intro: Commiphora parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved myrrh tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Burseraceae family and is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and fragrant resinous sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are unisexual, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants, and it produces a reddish-brown resin similar to myrrh. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it resilient to drought conditions.
